description: In a hospital room, a patient is almost entirely covered in bandages, lying in bed. Standing beside the bed are a doctor and another man who is heavily bandaged with casts on his arm and leg. The bandaged man is speaking to the doctor, discussing the state of the patient in the bed. The absurd conversation centers on whether the severely injured individual is merely sleeping or has died. This scenario highlights a darkly humorous perspective on injury and mortality within a clinical environment.
caption: “So there he was—this big gorilla just lying there. And Jim here says, ‘Do you suppose it’s dead or just asleep?’”

other_text.location: Bottom left, on the bed frame
